newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey gives casinos six months to close.
newsitem.headline: Turkey gives casinos six months to close.

text.p: Turkey's parliament on Thursday passed a law giving casinos six months to close down their operations, state-run Anatolian news agency said.
It said the Turkish President Suleyman Demirel had previously returned the bill to parliament for revision but the deputies passed it a second time with no changes.
The president is obliged to sign a bill passed unaltered by the assembly second time round.
The casinos would be given six months to close down after the date of publication of the law in the official gazette, or face prosecution, the agency said.
The bill was originally put forward by the previous Islamist-led government but was pursued by the successor secularist administration of Mesut Yilmaz.
Media reports said that casinos had become centres for money laundering and tax evasion as well as a cause of suicides among bankrupt gamblers faced with debts.
Gambling operations had already been curtailed by laws banning Turks from the casinos as well as dress codes and restricted weekday opening hours.
